title: Coach/Manager/Analyst Here! Looking for a team to be a part of
body:
Well hello :) 
I'm a low elo players, but what I lack in mechanical skills, I more than make up for in theory and knowledge of League of Legends. I've been doing one on one coaching for a while now, but now I want to see how well I can manage and coach a full team that's looking to climb the ladder this next season.
And with the new jungle/new items there is lots of new stuff to learn, so here I am presenting myself to the public :D 

If you're intrested or know someone who is, feel free to contact me on my Skype since it's easier for everybody that way.
Skype name: master-obi_wan5

Looking forward to hearing from you :)

replies.body:
> but what I lack in mechanical skills, I more than make up for in theory and knowledge of League of Legends.

You may believe that, but it's more than likely that you're suffering from the Dunning-Kruger effect. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dunning%E2%80%93Kruger_effect 
Just like every bronze-silver player who complains about ELO hell. Unless you have a physical handicap, why would you be low ELO while having such a high level of understanding?

Maybe I'm wrong, maybe you do have challenger level understanding, but no one is going to take you seriously until you can prove it, which would take time and a high level of trust. And honestly, why would any ambitious players bother to place that trust in you when you're a wild card with no track record?

Good luck with your search anyway.

Completely fair assumption. And trust me, I am NOT one to complain about elo hello when it doesn't even exist, yet just a term used as an excuse and mental block for players not willing to put in enough time to actually learn.
The reason I like to believe that I lack mechanical skill but have a higher understanding as a whole is because I play less than I read about abilities/champs/counters/plays and watch coaching/LCS, OGN, LPL etc. Of course I wouldn't say I have a challenger level knowledge but I believe that I possess enough information for a team/player to get past that mental block to get them higher in ladder. And once again I wouldn't say I have this knowledge or even compare myself to him, but L.i.E.S one of SKT T1's coaches is low gold division, yet their team won due to his teachings and mass knowledge.

Of course, I'm not bound to get hundreds of answers, hell, I'd be happy with one reply. But I have to get my name out there, and this seems like a good enough place to do so.

Cheers, man.
:)
